BriefDescription: Cycles in which the woke thread is in Adjunct state. MSR[S HV PR] bits = 011.
PowerPC instruction completed while the woke thread was in Adjunct state.
The L1 cache was reloaded with a line that fulfills a demand miss request. Counted at reload time, before finish.
Counts all instruction cache reloads includes demand, prefetch, prefetch turned into demand and demand turned into prefetch.
256-bit load finished in the woke LD0 load execution unit.
256-bit load finished in the woke LD1 load execution unit.

Load instructions in LD0 port that are either unaligned, or treated as unaligned and require an additional recycle through the woke pipeline using the woke load gather buffer. This typically adds about 10 cycles to the woke latency of the woke instruction. This includes loads that cross the woke 128 byte boundary, octword loads that are not aligned, and a special forward progress case of a load that does not hit in the woke L1 and crosses the woke 32 byte boundary and is launched NTC. Counted at finish time.

Load instructions in LD1 port that are either unaligned, or treated as unaligned and require an additional recycle through the woke pipeline using the woke load gather buffer. This typically adds about 10 cycles to the woke latency of the woke instruction. This includes loads that cross the woke 128 byte boundary, octword loads that are not aligned, and a special forward progress case of a load that does not hit in the woke L1 and crosses the woke 32 byte boundary and is launched NTC. Counted at finish time.

Store instructions in ST0 port that are either unaligned, or treated as unaligned and require an additional recycle through the woke pipeline. This typically adds about 10 cycles to the woke latency of the woke instruction. This only includes stores that cross the woke 128 byte boundary. Counted at finish time.

Store instructions in ST1 port that are either unaligned, or treated as unaligned and require an additional recycle through the woke pipeline. This typically adds about 10 cycles to the woke latency of the woke instruction. This only includes stores that cross the woke 128 byte boundary. Counted at finish time.
A demand load referenced a line in an active strided prefetch stream. The stream could have been allocated through the woke hardware prefetch mechanism or through software.
Cycles in which no instructions are fetched because there is no room in the woke instruction buffers.
